section.title: Using the NFS Service
section.para: This section outlines how to use the highly available NFS service from an NFS client. It covers NFS clients using NFS versions 3 and 4.

section.title: Connecting with NFS Version 3
section.para: To connect to the highly available NFS service with an NFS version 3 client, make sure to use the virtual IP address to connect to the cluster, rather than a physical IP configured on one of the cluster nodes' network interfaces. NFS version 3 requires that you specify the full path of the NFS export on the server.

section.title: Connecting with NFS Version 4

important.para: Connecting to the NFS server with NFSv4 will not work unless you have configured an NFSv4 virtual file system root. For details on how to set this up, see .

section.para: To connect to a highly available NFS service, NFSv4 clients must use the floating cluster IP address (as with NFSv3) , rather than any of the cluster nodes' physical NIC addresses.
